meanings.definition: A small songbird with a conical bill, typically found in wooded areas.
meanings.sent1: The colorful finches chirped happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of finches hopping around the forest.
meanings.sent3: The finches decided to have a singing competition in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The finches painted the sky with their melodious tunes.
meanings.sent5: The tiny finches brought life to the quiet forest with their songs.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'finch', referring to multiple individuals of the bird species.
meanings.sent1: Many finches gathered at the bird feeder in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The finches flew together in a beautiful formation.
meanings.sent3: The finches held a meeting to discuss their next migration.
meanings.sent4: The finches were a colorful mosaic in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The finches' fluttering wings created a mesmerizing sight in the sunlight.
